meanings.definition: Make (an issue or situation) less political.
meanings.sent1: The mayor promised to depoliticize the city council meetings to focus on community needs.
meanings.sent2: The organization aimed to depoliticize the decision-making process to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The idea of depoliticizing the school lunch menu led to a hilarious debate among the students.
meanings.sent4: She managed to depoliticize the tense conversation by shifting the focus to common goals.
meanings.sent5: The campaign to depoliticize healthcare sparked a wave of support from the public.

meanings.definition: Remove or reduce political influence or involvement.
meanings.sent1: The committee worked to depoliticize the selection process for transparency.
meanings.sent2: Efforts to depoliticize the judiciary system were met with mixed reactions from the public.
meanings.sent3: The proposal to depoliticize the office holiday party resulted in some unexpected fun.
meanings.sent4: She successfully depoliticized the negotiation by focusing on shared interests.
meanings.sent5: The initiative to depoliticize the media industry faced significant challenges.
